alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; East Platte County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 4:52PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Platte County through 530 PM MDT... At 452 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Bordeaux, or near Wheatland, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Wheatland, Chugcreek, Lakeview North, Bordeaux, Westview Circle, Y-O Ranch, Grayrocks Reservoir and Slater. This includes Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 69 and 87. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; East Platte County
